newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - July 28.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories Monday:
* General Motors is expected to announce a sponsoship deal worth several hundred million dollars with General Electric 's NBC and the United States Olympic Committee.
* Just as Palestinians are struggling to establish a state of their own, an independent Palestinian press is fighting to be born.
* The personal computer market continued to grow robustly in the second quarter.
* Credit Lyonnais has agreed to sell its majority stake in Credito Bergamasco of Italy to another Italian bank, Banca Popolare di Verona, for close to $700 million.
* Office Depot, which scaled back its advertising when it agreed to merge with Staples, is looking to reinvigorate its efforts in the wake of the government's rejection of the deal.
* As the computing and cable television industries attempt to upgrade television, Microsoft is among the companies intent on finding out how the concept of TV channels might evolve.
* "Boycot de Euro" is one of scores of "Eurosceptic" groups that have emerged as one of the most pugnacious political movements on the Internet.
